array.description: George Washington became the first President of the United States after being elected in 1789.
John Adams was elected as the second President of the United States in 1797.
Thomas Jefferson was elected as the third President of the United States in 1801.
James Madison was elected as the fourth President of the United States in 1809.
James Monroe was elected as the fifth President of the United States in 1817.
John Quincy Adams was elected as the sixth President of the United States in 1825.
Andrew Jackson was elected as the seventh President of the United States in 1829.
Martin Van Buren was elected as the eighth President of the United States in 1837.
William Henry Harrison was elected as the ninth President of the United States in 1841.
John Tyler succeeded William Henry Harrison as the tenth President of the United States after Harrison's death in 1841.
James K. Polk was elected as the eleventh President of the United States in 1845.
Zachary Taylor was elected as the twelfth President of the United States in 1849.
Millard Fillmore succeeded Zachary Taylor as the thirteenth President of the United States after Taylor's death in 1850.
Franklin Pierce was elected as the fourteenth President of the United States in 1853.
James Buchanan was elected as the fifteenth President of the United States in 1857.
Abraham Lincoln was elected as the sixteenth President of the United States in 1861.
Andrew Johnson succeeded Abraham Lincoln as the seventeenth President of the United States after Lincoln's assassination in 1865.
Ulysses S. Grant was elected as the eighteenth President of the United States in 1869.
Rutherford B. Hayes was elected as the nineteenth President of the United States in 1877.
James A. Garfield was elected as the twentieth President of the United States in 1881.
Chester A. Arthur succeeded James A. Garfield as the twenty-first President of the United States after Garfield's assassination in 1881.
Grover Cleveland was elected as the twenty-second President of the United States in 1885.
Benjamin Harrison was elected as the twenty-third President of the United States in 1889.
Grover Cleveland was reelected and served as the twenty-fourth President of the United States from 1893 to 1897.
William McKinley was elected as the twenty-fifth President of the United States in 1897.
Theodore Roosevelt succeeded William McKinley as the twenty-sixth President of the United States after McKinley's assassination in 1901.
William Howard Taft was elected as the twenty-seventh President of the United States in 1909.
Woodrow Wilson was elected as the twenty-eighth President of the United States in 1913.
Warren G. Harding was elected as the twenty-ninth President of the United States in 1921.
Calvin Coolidge succeeded Warren G. Harding as the thirtieth President of the United States after Harding's death in 1923.
Herbert Hoover was elected as the thirty-first President of the United States in 1929.

array.summary: Franklin D. Roosevelt elected four times
array.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt was elected to four consecutive terms as the thirty-second President of the United States, serving from 1933 to 1945.
Harry S. Truman succeeded Franklin D. Roosevelt as the thirty-third President of the United States after Roosevelt's death in 1945.
Dwight D. Eisenhower was elected as the thirty-fourth President of the United States in 1953.
John F. Kennedy was elected as the thirty-fifth President of the United States in 1961.
Lyndon B. Johnson succeeded John F. Kennedy as the thirty-sixth President of the United States after Kennedy's assassination in 1963.
Richard Nixon was elected as the thirty-seventh President of the United States in 1969.
Gerald Ford succeeded Richard Nixon as the thirty-eighth President of the United States after Nixon's resignation in 1974.
Jimmy Carter was elected as the thirty-ninth President of the United States in 1977.
Ronald Reagan was elected as the fortieth President of the United States in 1981.
George H. W. Bush was elected as the forty-first President of the United States in 1989.
Bill Clinton was elected as the forty-second President of the United States in 1993.
George W. Bush was elected as the forty-third President of the United States in 2001.
Barack Obama was elected as the forty-fourth President of the United States in 2009.
Donald Trump was elected as the forty-fifth President of the United States in 2017.
Joe Biden was elected as the forty-sixth President of the United States in 2021.
